cons: Press SPACE to listen to Song / Press CTRL to open Gameplay Changers Menu / Press RESET to Reset your Score and Accuracy
Press SPACE to listen to Song[No Voice] / Press CTRL to open Gameplay Changers Menu / Press RESET to Reset your Score and Accuracy
Press CTRL to open Gameplay Changers Menu / Press RESET to Reset your Score and Accuracy
Press SPACE to Pause / Press ESCAPE to Exit / Press R to Replay This Song
Press SPACE to Resume / Press ESCAPE to Exit / Press R to Reset SongPosition

descr.b: Beat Week 1 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.c: Beat Week 2 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.d: Beat Week 3 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.e: Beat Week 4 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.f: Beat Week 5 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.g: Beat Week 6 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.h: Beat Week 7 on Hard with no Misses.
descr.i: Complete a Song with a rating lower than 20%.
descr.j: Complete a Song with a rating of 100%.
descr.l: Hold down a note for 10 seconds.
descr.m: Finish a Song without going Idle.
descr.n: Finish a Song pressing only two keys.
descr.o: Have you tried to run the game on a toaster?
descr.p: When the "Lunatic" mode is turned on,play any song is completed with the standard of "FC" when there is a random is "InstakillOnMiss".
descr.q: Beat the "Test" Stage from the Chart Editor.

note_color.cons1: Press RELOAD to Reset the selected Note Part
cons2: + Press RESET key to fully reset the selected Note

grap.opt1:
If checked, disables some background details,
decreases loading times and improves performance.
grap.opt2:
If unchecked, disables anti-aliasing, increases performance
at the cost of sharper visuals.
grap.opt3:
If unchecked, disables shaders.
It's used for some visual effects, and aso CPU intensive for weaker PCs.
grap.opt4: If unchecked, FPS is like a rainbow
grap.opt5:
If checked, allows the GPU to be used for caching textures, decreasing RAM usage.
Don't turn this on if you have a shitty Graphics Card.
grap.opt7:
If checked, images loaded will stay in memory
until the game is closed, this increases memory usage,
but basically makes reloading times instant.

VAU.opt2: Select your prefered Note Splash variation or turn it off.
VAU.opt3: How much transparent should the Note Splashes be.
VAU.opt4: If checked, hides most HUD elements.
VAU.opt5: If checked, Display "combo" when the combo is greater than 10.
VAU.opt6: If checked, MS will be displayed.
VAU.opt7: What should the Time Bar display?
VAU.opt8: Uncheck this if you're sensitive to flashing lights!
VAU.opt9: If unchecked, the camera won't zoom in on a beat hit.
VAU.opt11:
If unchecked, disables the Score text zooming
everytime you hit a note.
VAU.opt12: How much transparent should the health bar and icons be.
VAU.opt14: What song do you prefer for the Pause Screen?
VAU.opt15: On Release builds, turn this on to check for updates when you start the game.
VAU.opt16: If unchecked, Ratings and Combo won't stack, saving on System Memory and making them easier to read

gameplay.opt1: If checked, notes go Down instead of Up, simple enough.
gameplay.opt2: If checked, your notes get centered.
gameplay.opt3: If checked, listening songs have Voices
gameplay.opt4: If unchecked, opponent notes get hidden.
gameplay.opt5:
If checked, you won't get misses from pressing keys
while there are no notes able to be hit.
gameplay.opt6:
Select a health mode 
(affects the increase and decrease of blood volume)
gameplay.opt7: If checked, the game automatically pauses if the screen isn't on focus.
gameplay.opt8: If checked, pressing Reset won't do anything.
gameplay.opt9: Funny notes does "Tick!" when you hit them.
gameplay.opt10:
Changes how late/early you have to hit for a "Sick!"
Higher values mean you have to hit later.
gameplay.opt11:
Changes the amount of time you have
for hitting a "Sick!" in milliseconds.
gameplay.opt12:
Changes the amount of time you have
for hitting a "Good" in milliseconds.
gameplay.opt13:
Changes the amount of time you have
for hitting a "Bad" in milliseconds.
gameplay.opt14:
Changes how many frames you have for
hitting a note earlier or late.
gameplay.opt16: Select the fonts that can be used for that language
gameplay.opt17:
WARNING! If unchecked, this may result in a language display error!
Unless you know what you're doing!!

ES.opt2: If checked, ALL support will be enabled in version 0.6.x
ES.opt3: If checked, Game support TABLET or ANDROID
ES.opt4: Zoom Modes, Section, Beat or Step

andro.tip: Press BACK to Go Back to Options Menu

EventS:
Used in Dad Battle,
Value 1: 0/1 = ON/OFF,
2 = Target Dad
3 = Target BF

Plays the "Hey!" animation from Bopeebo,
Value 1: BF = Only Boyfriend, GF = Only Girlfriend,
Something else = Both.
Value 2: Custom animation duration,
leave it blank for 0.6s

Sets GF head bopping speed,
Value 1: 1 = Normal speed,
2 = 1/2 speed, 4 = 1/4 speed etc.
Used on Fresh during the beatbox parts.

Warning: Value must be integer!

Exclusive to Week 3
Value 1: 0/1/2 = OFF/ON/Reset Gradient
 
No, i won't add it to other weeks.
For Mom's songs, don't use this please, i love them :(

Used on MILF on that one "hard" part
Value 1: Camera zoom add (Default: 0.015)
Value 2: UI zoom add (Default: 0.03)
Leave the values blank if you want to use Default.
Should be used only in "school" Stage!
Should be used only in "schoolEvil" Stage!

Plays an animation on a Character,
once the animation is completed,
the animation changes to Idle

Value 1: Animation to play.
Value 2: Character (Dad, BF, GF)

Value 1: X
Value 2: Y

The camera won't change the follow point
after using this, for getting it back
to normal, leave both values blank.

Sets a specified suffix after the idle animation name.
You can use this to trigger 'idle-alt' if you set
Value 2 to -alt

Value 1: Character to set (Dad, BF or GF)
Value 2: New suffix (Leave it blank to disable)

Value 1: Camera shake
Value 2: HUD shake

Every value works as the following example: "1, 0.05".
The first number (1) is the duration.
The second number (0.05) is the intensity.

Value 1: Character to change (Dad, BF, GF)
Value 2: New character's name

Value 1: Scroll Speed Multiplier (1 is default)
Value 2: Time it takes to change fully in seconds.

Value 1: Variable name
Value 2: New value

Value 1: Sound file name
Value 2: Volume (Default: 1), ranges from 0 to 1

tips.tips1: W/S or Mouse Wheel - Change Conductor's strum time
tips.tips2: A/D - Go to the previous/next section
tips.tips4: Up/Down - Change Conductor's Strum Time with Snapping
tips.tips4.1: Left Bracket / Right Bracket - Change Song Playback Rate (SHIFT to go Faster)
tips.tips4.2: ALT + Left Bracket / Right Bracket - Reset Song Playback Rate
tips.tips6: Hold Control and click on an arrow to select it
tips.tips8: Esc - Test your chart inside Chart Editor
